title: Anyone here play Poker?
body:
I started playing it seriously about 3 months ago and it's been a profitable venture. It might even become my "job." Made over double my bankroll within that time.

Putting the time and effort into studying like a real job or project pays off in the long run. 

What's y'all's experience with the game? {{champion:4}}

Sources which I study from: (ordered in entertainment value)

* Poker After Dark: The Cash Game/Any pro player montage or spotlights [Highly entertaining, not much to learn]

* Jason Somerville http://runitup.com/ [inspired me to take poker seriously. Entertaining, tons and tons of videos and livestreams, and medium learning value.]

* PokerStaples http://www.twitch.tv/pokerstaples [Mildly boring, medium learning. Good tournament source]

* Harrington on Hold'em [book series. Extremely well written, almost a required read for tournaments and poker in general]

* Gripsed http://www.gripsed.com/ [Fairly boring, solidly advanced, very good at mindset and philosophy training.]

* James "Splitsuit" Sweeney https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLYzd2pigivfbl2OpYq1Vxg [extremely boring, extremely advanced and in depth. By far the best learning source I've found, but very difficult to get through everything.]
